projects.title: Acceptable Quality Level (AQL) programme
projects.description: Design, implementation and execution of first ever on site Acceptable Quality Level (AQL) programme. Previously, our site had not yet introduced the AQL methods. Many articles were read, referenced and studies conducted in order to  develop the on site specific AQL procedures.

contributors.headline: Validation and Compliance (GxP) Engineer at Janssen Biologics BV (through Agidens and TailorMinds)
Quality Systems Team Leader at Aspen Pharma Group

projects.title: Bulk Hold Time Study Programme
projects.description: Design, introduction, implementation and execution of first ever on site Bulk Hold Time Studies programme. The BHTS is designed to establish a basic stability profile of finished bulk product, stored in its holding vessel/container for a maximum specified period, prior to its next processing step and the effects thereof. Future plans are to extend this to raw materials too. The programme includes Risk Assessments, development of standard operating procedures and protocols.

contributors.headline: Validation and Compliance (GxP) Engineer at Janssen Biologics BV (through Agidens and TailorMinds)

projects.title: Campaign Studies Programme
projects.description: Design, implementation and execution of first ever on site Campaign study programme. Campaign studies are designed to validate the efficacy of cleaning (CIP or manual) activities following the consecutive run of 6 batches of product - regardless of the number of days this runs over. The project includes the development of risk assessments, product quality impact, development of standard operating procedures and protocols.

contributors.headline: Validation and Compliance (GxP) Engineer at Janssen Biologics BV (through Agidens and TailorMinds)
Quality Systems Team Leader at Aspen Pharma Group

projects.title: Dirty Hold Time Study Programme
projects.description: Design, implementation and execution of first ever on site Dirty Hold Time Studies programme.  The dirty hold time study principle is simple: validate how long reference equipment can stay in solid state for, then cleaned accordingly, without impacting on cleaning activities. Activities included the identification of risks via Risk Assessments, the development of standard operating procedures and protocols.

contributors.headline: Validation and Compliance (GxP) Engineer at Janssen Biologics BV (through Agidens and TailorMinds)
Quality Systems Team Leader at Aspen Pharma Group

projects.title: Grade D Pharmaceutical Manufacturing Facility CIP Upgrade
projects.description: Upgrade of the CIP systems for a multi dosage form pharmaceutical manufacturing facility with shared equipment capabilities with the aim of reducing cleaning times to ensure higher product output.

contributors.headline: Validation and Compliance (GxP) Engineer at Janssen Biologics BV (through Agidens and TailorMinds)

projects.title: International Nelson Mandela Day
projects.description: As a member of the Nelson Mandela Day Committee, I am involved in nominating, selecting, event planning, fund raising and execution of planned activities for the selected beneficiary of our time and assistance on Nelson Mandela which, to date, has benefited a local Old Aged Home and Primary School in our local community.

company.name: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson

profile_positions.company: The Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson
profile_positions.description: Analytical equipment qualification and life cycle management (commissioning and decommissioning).  Preparation and execution of qualification related documentation (for example:  URS, IOPQ, SOP/WI, Change Controls), processes and associated activities to ensure the compliant qualification of the various analytical equipment categories, as well as the retirement of analytical equipment - in line with applicable local, EU, and where necessary, FDA requirements.
profile_positions.title: Validation and Compliance (GxP) Engineer - At Agidens through TailorMinds

profile_positions.description:
Validation Specialist for International Diagnostics Company, ensuring compliance to GMP and ISO 13485 for products moving production facilities between South Africa and the United States of America. 
- Validation Lead for a multidisciplinary, multinational team in:
1. Process Validation
2. Cleaning Validation
3. Shipping Validation
4. Advisor for QC Lab Equipment Qualification
- Protocol writing, report writing
- SOP updates
- Risk Assessments
profile_positions.title: Validation Specialist

profile_positions.description: Validation Specialist for Installation of SVP manufacturing equipment and filling line.
profile_positions.title: Validation Specialist

profile_positions.description:
	Performing cleaning validations (and associated activities) for a Grade D pharmaceutical manufacturing facility.
	Development, planning, execution and management of the cleaning validation program, inclusive of cleaning evaluations and verification.
	Development, planning, execution and management of clean hold time studies, dirty hold time studies, campaign studies and bulk hold time studies.
	Development, implementation and testing of sequential manual and automated (CIP) cleaning processes via both operator and software (HMI, PLC and SCADA) execution for dosage forms:  liquids, suspensions, tinctures, solutions, semi-solids, creams, ointments, emulsions, solids and oral contraceptives.
	Writing, review and approval of validation studies protocols and reports.
	Writing, review, approval and training of standard operating procedures.
	Ensuring validation compliance to cGMP and SAHPRA regulatory requirements.
	Writing and review of deviations, change controls, corrective actions/preventative actions, risk assessments.
	Management of cleaning validation matrix and Site Validation Master plan.
	Selection, calculation and testing of worst case scenario API's via MACO, NOEL and PDE formulae. 
	Execution of validation activities by means of swabbing and testing for API and microbiological content, collection of TOC and Rinse media samples.
	CAPEX motivation and User Requirement Specification preparation for equipment and software development
profile_positions.title: Validation Technologist (Cleaning Validation)

profile_positions.description:
	Planning and execution of process validation activities (batch manufacture of trial, process validation, source change batches).
	Product development by means of process validation management.
	Design and execution of Technical Transfer and Technical Evaluation batches, protocol and reports.
	Design and execution of process validation protocols and reports - including process flow diagrams as well as identification and verification of critical parameters.
	Recommending, updating and approval of batch manufacture documentation and instructions.
	Management of process validation status via validation matrix.
	Verification of manufacturing machinery processing capabilities.
	Process validation of several dosage forms including; liquids, suspensions, solutions, tinctures, syrups, creams, ointments, suppositories, solids and oral contraceptives.
	Review and approval of final product specification results, including uniformity of content, API and IPI content.
	Management of deviations, change control and CAPA's via Process Compliance.
	Investigation, solving and introduction of solutions to product failures.
	Introduction of AQL (Acceptable Quality Limits) system.
	Regulatory Alliance and amendment guidance (Type A, B and C) evaluation, monitoring and correspondence.
profile_positions.title: Validation Technologist (Process Validation)

profile_positions.description:
	Supervisor and Pharmaceutical support for Dispensary (raw material dispensing).
	Planning and monitoring of dispensing activities.
	Check-way and verification of item codes, batch numbers and expiry dates as per batch manufacturing instructions
	Specific storage condition monitoring controls such as fridge line items, hazardous and flammable substances, scheduled substances, IPI'S and API's.
	Ensuring cGMP, Quality and Safety regulations are met at all times.
	Conducting internal departmental auditing.
	11 direct personnel reporting to me (7 Dispensing Operators and 4 Stock Handlers, therefore Industrial Relations exposure and personnel performance management).
	Planning and execution of stock take.
	Facility and Equipment monitoring via OnKey.
	Creating, updating, modifying, releasing and training of facility personnel on role specific standard operating procedures.
	Bulk batch manufacture monitoring and packaging monitoring.
	Verification of cleaning activities (opening and closing of processing lines).
	Auditing of batch documentation.
profile_positions.title: Supervisor / Pharmaceutical Support (Pharmacist Assistant Post Basic)

profile_positions.title: Production Pharmacist Assistant and GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices) Training Officer

profile_positions.description:
	Dispensing activities:  reading and preparation of prescriptions both acute and chronic
	Liaising with Doctors and Medical Aids a-like with regards to prescription queries, chronic authorisations and general queries
	Ordering, unpacking and capturing of stock (both scheduled substances and complimentary medicines).  Ensuring both FIFO and FEFO.
	Communicating and handlings with suppliers (returns, queries, order discrepancies)
	Performing weekly cycle counts and bi-annual stock takes
	Advising and dispensing on Over the Counter (OTC) medicines and complimentary medicines (under supervision of a qualified and registered Pharmacist)
	Updating and monitoring of pharmacy performance in terms of customer turn over time and profitability
	Working with customers and handling customer complaints
	Environmental monitoring
	Compounding of mixtures for medicinal purposes
	Handling of payments from customers
	Updating and implementation of SOP’s.
	Attending product work-shops and training sessions
profile_positions.title: Pharmacist Assistant
